newsitem.title: EGYPT: Omani Sultan in Egypt for peace, trade talks.
newsitem.headline: Omani Sultan in Egypt for peace, trade talks.

text.p: Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak met Oman's Sultan Qaboos bin Said on Saturday in the Red Sea resort of Sharm el-Sheikh for talks on trade and the Middle East peace process, officials said.
Mubarak embraced Qaboos at Sharm el-Sheikh airport, where the local bedouins danced and sang in welcome.
The two leaders and their delegations then headed to a luxury hotel where they would hold talks.
Officials said that Qaboos, who is on his first visit to Egypt since June 1996, will spend three days touring the Sinai peninsula looking at investment prospects in the area.
Boosting trade ties is also on the agenda, the officials added. Egypt is trying to develop the Sinai as part of a drive to ease pressures on the densely-populated Nile Valley.
The officials also said that the deadlock in the Middle East peace process was one of the key topics Mubarak and Qaboos would discuss.
Egypt is mediating between Israel and the Palestinians to restart peace talks stalled since March when the Jewish state broke ground on a new settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
